meanings.def: the total amount of goods or services sold by a company during a particular period of time
examples: The combined turnover of both businesses has doubled in the last two years.
Turnover fell from £12 million to £11 million.
Turnover was down compared with last year's figures.
A 10% rise in turnover would increase company profits by $3.3 million.
Calculate your profit by subtracting your costs from your turnover.

meanings.def: the rate at which employees leave a company and are replaced by other people
examples: We've had very little turnover in our sales personnel.
The new offices have reduced the very high rates of staff turnover.
The city has a rapid population turnover.

meanings.def: the rate at which goods are sold in a shop and replaced by others
a small pie in the shape of a triangle or half a circle, filled with fruit or jam
